responses.rationale: The segment describes price changes, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes actions taken by companies in response to shortages, not capabilities or preparedness measures against the outbreak.
The segment describes actions taken by companies in response to shortages, not capabilities or preparedness measures against the outbreak.
The segment describes the ongoing outbreak and its impact, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment reports the detection of the virus, not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes response measures/safeguards: "are to slaughter the chickens and disinfect the farm to prevent the spread".
The segment describes the spread of the virus, not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes a safeguard/measure: "prompting the government to impose poultry flocks be kept indoors".
Describes a past response measure: "led the authorities to cull over 3 million ducks".
The segment describes potential consequences (trade restrictions), not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes concern and potential transmission, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes the transmission method, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment compares numbers of birds killed/slaughtered, describing impact.
The segment highlights the difficulty of keeping the virus out, not a successful capability.
The segment describes the pattern of cases appearing, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes the impact (birds slaughtered), not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes price, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes price changes, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes price changes, not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes safeguards/measures taken by farmers: "requiring workers to shower and change clothes", "sanitizing trucks", "investing in separate sets of tools".
Describes safeguards/measures taken by farms: "upgraded barn ventilation and installed laser systems".
Stresses the importance of a safeguard concept: "biosecurity".
The segment describes the cost of the response, not capabilities or preparedness measures themselves.
The segment describes costs/damages, not capabilities or preparedness.
Mentions applying "lessons learned" which implies improved preparedness/response.
Describes a safeguard/measure: "Properly cooking poultry and eggs... will also kill any viruses".
Describes development capability and future possibility: "vaccines are being developed and might help in the future".
The segment describes challenges/impracticality, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes challenges/impracticality, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment reports confirmed cases, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes transmission and impact, not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes response measures/safeguards: "affected areas have been quarantined and birds on the properties will be depopulated to prevent the spread".
Describes a planned response measure: "were set to be euthanized".
Describes response measures: "be humanely depopulated and disposed of", "farm had also been quarantined immediately".
The segment reports total impact (birds killed), not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes capability/preparedness: "has the strongest AI surveillance program", "is working with its partners to actively look for the disease".
The segment describes expected price increases, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes potential economic impact, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes past impact (human cases/deaths), not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes the virus's potential future capability, not human capability/preparedness.
The segment expresses concern, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment provides background information, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment provides background and perspective, not capabilities or preparedness measures.

The segment describes a past scientific finding, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment expresses uncertainty, not capabilities or preparedness.

The segment provides biographical detail, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment poses a question about feelings/perspective, not capabilities or preparedness.

Describes procurement of vaccines (preparedness/resource acquisition): "vaccines will be jointly procured".
